I like this game because it's something really new for me. But I wouldn't recommend this game for you because developers aren't doing anything with bugs, unbalanced perks and add-ons and even more things. If they do some update, it is all about costumes or some new killer or surv or both. But repairing their game is too hard for them I think. Survivors are all about practice (but that's in every game that you have to practice) and teamwork, but with this garbage community you have to play rather solo than with team. This game has really bad anti cheat. Killers are about perks and add-ons (if you don't wanna play nurse that is hard and boring to play). Well you can play without perks and add-ons, but it will be a lot harder, bcs not many players play this game so you will almost always play against good survs with good perks and items. But even if this game has so many problems, I still like it but the devs should work with game and not doing updates that will give them some money. And the last thing is that you have to pay if you wanna play more killers or survs.

I was holding my axe and not knowing what to expect. I was hyped - time to hunt down some corn thieves. Blood was pumping through my veins and my heart was racing as I buried my axe into my first victim. I put him over my shoulder as the victim tried to wiggle away and drop down from my shoulders to run away. Just before he managed to succeed at it, I lifted him and thrust his left shoulder through a massive meat hook  on the edge of my corn field. "Nobody ain't stealin' me corn" I said to myself. 

On the edge of my eye, I saw another person running with corns in their pockets. I proceeded towards the thief with my giant axe leaned over my shoulder. The person was going to run away so I took one of my trusty hatchets and threw it at the person. It buried itself into her back, knocking her down and the corn she was holding. I walked over to her and grabbed her. She moaned as I put her on my shoulder and started walking towards my other meat hook - in middle of the cornfield. "These are me foking corns m8 and nobody steals my foking corn m8" I kept telling myself as I thrust her shoulder through the meat hook.
As time passed by, I tracked down 2 more thieves stealing my corn. I buried my axe and hatches into them and hooked them onto my meat hooks and offered them as sacrafices to the Great Entity of beyond, knowing that it would watch over my cornfield as a thanks.

It was done. All thieves were hooked and dead and my cornfield was free at least. No thief would ever try to steal my corn. I walked back to my farmshed, washed my hands and my trusty axe. Tired and exhausted I sat down, turned on Steam and started to play Dead by Daylight.

10/10 would kill more corn thieves.
11/10 best cornfield thief run-down simulator.

Ignore these trolls who crap on the game because they are salty. The game itself is fun and exciting.

It can be a very fun game if all the players are actually trying to make it fun. Good luck finding players like that unless you play with friends. It might just be me but there's some buggy, janky nonsense in this game. I could get over that if it didn't seem like a majority of the player base utilizes play styles that suck all the fun out of it. You get a lot of selfish people doing whatever it takes for points, screw everyone else. You also get a lot, a looooot of whiney people. Now, to be fair, personal attitudes aside- the playstyles that kill the fun are perfectly allowed. So are a lot of things in life that make **** poor human beings. Oh well. As for that "get good" nonsense . . . who would willingly slog through hundreds of hours in this toxic morass to improve to the point that they can be the jerk that completely crushes the very spirit of sportsmanship? If that sort of thing is actually up your alley, fine. Have fun, at the expense of others or not. That sort of thing is, as I said, perfectly allowed.

In short: Start playing, it's fun for a while. Get to the middle ground, people start to suck (I don't mean skill-wise, either). Keep playing long enough, become a worse human being than when you started but you sure are good at video games now.

This game in all in everyway is extremely unbalenced, For a while they made the survivors overpowered compared to 9 of the 12 killers in the game (and completely demolished like 3) while the huntress, nurse, and the hillbilly were still on par or better than survivors.
